overview: This subject introduces a variety of methods and philosophies for the analysis of Western tonal and atonal music, each with its own strengths and limitations. Students undertake practical analysis assignments using different techniques, as well as a final project analysing a work of their own choice.
ilo: analyse musical works in a variety of styles using appropriate techniques;
present musical insights clearly, within the notational conventions and terminology of particular analytical methods;
make informed choices about methods of analysis applicable in different contexts.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: 3 written assignments – analysis (20% each) equivalent to 800 words each.
2 written assignments – analysis (5% each) equivalent to 200 words each.
Final written assignment (free choice analytical project)

date_times.contact_hours: 36 hours, comprising one 2-hour lecture and one 1-hour tutorial per week
